Name: Requiring the department of education to report information about employees of school bus transportation vendors.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report information about employees of school bus transportation vendors

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 7, 2024

Summary: This bill would amend current Department of Education (DOE) reporting on the number of school bus transportation employees to require DOE to report on, for each employee job classification, route assignment, including whether a general or special education route assignment; and type of training completed, including training on the needs of students with disabilities.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Paragraph 3 of subdivision b of section 21-993 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 34 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows:
      3. The total number of employees known to the department employed by each school bus vendor, disaggregated by [type] the following:
      (a) Job classification, including but not limited to [drivers]driver, [attendants]attendant, and other, and whether such employee accompanies students on the school bus route; 
      (b) For each job classification listed in subparagraph (a) of this paragraph, current school bus route assignment, including whether it is a general education school bus route or special education school bus route; and
      (c) For each job classification listed in subparagraph (a) of this paragraph, type of training completed, including, but not limited to, training on the needs of students with disabilities, and a description of such training;
     � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
